keyword: how many calories in chicken and rice
title: How Many Calories in Chicken and Rice?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in chicken and rice for a standard serving, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in Chicken and Rice?
assumptions: One serving: 150g cooked skinless chicken breast + 200g cooked white rice, plain grilled/boiled, no added oil, sauce, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by chicken cut, rice type, portion sizes, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or recipes when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard serving of chicken and rice provides ~508 kcal, with 52 g protein and 56 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use brown rice instead of white
Include 1 tsp olive oil in cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in a serving of chicken and rice?
faqs.a: About 508 kcal for 150g chicken + 200g white rice.

faqs.q: What's the protein in chicken and rice?
faqs.a: Roughly 52 g protein, mostly from the chicken breast.

faqs.q: Does chicken and rice have a lot of carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, about 56 g carbs from the rice; choose brown rice for more fiber.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in chicken and rice?
faqs.a: Reduce rice portion, use skinless chicken, or add veggies instead of sauce.

faqs.q: Is this for cooked or raw chicken and rice?
faqs.a: Cooked weights; raw chicken shrinks ~25% when cooked.
